title: Laurence Nardon: 'In line with Trump, Bidenomics reinforces proud American protectionism'
description: The political scientist analyzes the successes and limitations of the Democratic administration's reforms, which, although aimed primarily at the middle classes by breaking with neoliberalism, are struggling to win them over politically.

title: Nepal rushes aid and rescue operations after strong quake shakes its northwest, killing at least 157
description: Most of the victims were crushed by debris when their houses – usually made by stacking rocks and logs – crumbled under the force of the tremblor midnight Friday, local media reported.

title: Football: Real Madrid deny reports about Mbappé negotiations
description: The club denied Saturday that they are in negotiations to sign Paris Saint-Germain striker Kylian Mbappé at the end of his contract in June 2024 after recent reports suggested they were in talks.

title: Woman stabbed in France, prosecutor says motive possibly anti-Semitic, police sources urge 'caution'
description: A police source told Le Monde that 'it is too early to attribute this attack to an anti-Semitic act.' No arrests have been made.

title: Miyazaki in Le Monde, the long road to celebration
description: The master of Japanese animation's 12th feature film, 'The Boy and the Heron,' is in French cinemas on November 1. His name didn't appear in the newspaper until June 1993, even though the filmmaker had already produced such masterpieces as 'Castle in the Sky,' 'Spirited Away' and 'Princess Mononoke.'

title: Javier Milei's biggest supporters are young Argentinian libertarians
description: Young libertarian voters, against welfare and progressivism and for small government, see the populist economist Milei as their candidate for Argentina's presidential election.

title: Iron, fire and blood rain down on encircled Gaza City
description: The Israeli army has completely encircled Gaza City, its main battleground against Hamas forces, and has exposed more than half a million people to combat and shortages of food and water.

title: In one French territory, thousands of children are excluded from education: 'I want to go to school too'
description: According to France's Defender of Rights, there are 'more than 15,000 children' without access to conventional schooling in the Indian Ocean territory of Mayotte. Because schools are overcrowded, an organization has come to their aid and the local education authority is well aware of the problem.

title: 50 Cent ruins his tour's final stop
description: On Friday, the American star performed in Paris, celebrating the 20th anniversary of his first studio album, 'Get Rich or Die Tryin.'

title: Jason Furman: 'The US  is making progress on some of its most stubborn problems'
description: Although all the indicators for the US economy are green, persistently high inflation could cast a shadow over the end of President Joe Biden's term, warns the former chairman of Barack Obama's Council of Economic Advisers.

title: In East Jerusalem, Gazan cancer patients suffer far from home
description: More than 200 Gazan patients who could not be treated in the enclave are stuck in two East Jerusalem hospitals.

title: Macron walks a tightrope over the war in Gaza
description: The French president has been confronted with domestic tensions over the war between Israel and Hamas. He plans to hold a 'humanitarian conference' on November 9.

title: Iranian Minister Amir-Abdollahian aspires to lead the 'axis of resistance' against Israel and the United States
description: Closely aligned with the Revolutionary Guard, the Iranian head of diplomacy takes advantage of his status to travel abroad and speak on behalf of Tehran's allies.

title: The insurmountable failure of France's strategy in the Sahel
description: 'France-Africa, the breakdown' (2/3). France's overemphasis on the security aspect of its strategy in the West African region, at the expense of supporting the development of various states, led to the failure of a decade of military presence.

title: Ukraine fears being forgotten amid Middle East conflict
description: Kyiv is worried that the support from the US and its Western allies will shift in favor of Israel. In an interview in 'The Economist,' the commander-in-chief of the Ukrainian forces, Valery Zaluzhny, gave an alarming assessment of the situation.

title: Chéri Samba: 'I know how my painting will end'
description: In an interview with Le Monde, the Congolese artist talks about his career and creative process, on the occasion of a retrospective at the Musée Maillol in Paris.

title: Germany: Far-right AfD lawmaker suspected of having close ties to neo-Nazi circles
description: Bavarian MP Daniel Halemba, 22, was arrested following the discovery of suspected Nazi artifacts linked to him.

title: Nepal: Earthquake kills at least 60 people
description: A strong earthquake shook northwestern Nepal districts just before midnight Friday, and officials said at least 60 people were dead and dozens more injured as rescuers searched mountain villages.

title: Iran sentences woman to death for adultery
description: Iran faces global scrutiny for its frequent use of the death penalty. UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres on Wednesday said that Iran has executed 419 individuals in the first seven months of this year, marking a 30% increase from the previous year.

title: PSG beat Montpellier to go atop Ligue 1
description: Reigning champions PSG moved two points clear of Nice of Friday after a defiant 3-0 win at the Parc de Princes.
